title: Cardiovascular Risk in Orthotopic Liver Transplantation (CAR-OLT)
description: Predicts cardiovascular risk in orthotopic liver transplantation. The CAR-OLT score predicts the 1-year risk for death or hospitalization related to a major CVD event (myocardial infarction, cardiac revascularization, heart failure, atrial fibrillation, cardiac arrest, pulmonary embolism, or stroke) after liver transplantation.

parameters.name: age_category
parameters.description: Patient age category at time of transplant

references: VanWagner LB, Serper M, Kang R, Levitsky J, Hohmann S, Abecassis M, Skaro A, Lloyd-Jones DM. Factors Associated With Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events After Liver Transplantation Among a National Sample. Am J Transplant. 2016 Sep;16(9):2684-94.

VanWagner LB, Ning H, Whitsett M, Levitsky J, Uttal S, Wilkins JT, Abecassis MM, Ladner DP, Skaro AI, Lloyd-Jones DM. A point-based prediction model for cardiovascular risk in orthotopic liver transplantation: The CAR-OLT score. Hepatology. 2017 Dec;66(6):1968-1979.
formula: CAR-OLT Score = Age points + Sex points + Race points + Working status points + Education points + Atrial fibrillation points + Respiratory failure points + Pulmonary hypertension points + HCC points + Hypertension points + Diabetes points + Heart failure points
notes: The CAR-OLT score is available online at www.carolt.us and as mobile apps
Major CVD events include: MI, cardiac revascularization (PCI or CABG), heart failure, atrial fibrillation, cardiac arrest, pulmonary embolism, or stroke
Score was developed in 1,024 liver transplant recipients aged 18-75 years
Higher scores indicate higher 1-year cardiovascular risk after liver transplantation
